body: You beat me to it by 4 minutes ðŸ˜„ https://github.com/airbnb/lottie-android/issues/1838 I also forked the repo to reproduce the issue.

issue.title: Compose crash: No virtual method setImageAssetManager

repository.name: lottie-android
repository.description: Render After Effects animations natively on Android and iOS, Web, and React Native

issue.body:
Repro commit for 1.0.0-beta09-1-SNAPSHOT:
https://github.com/headsvk/lottie-android/commit/ff2e2445d728f0bf2d1896a3b5bb45149f7ca0e3

Steps:
- Run issue-repro-commit app and it crashes instantly with the following error:

```
E/AndroidRuntime: FATAL EXCEPTION: main
    Process: com.airbnb.lottie.issues.compose, PID: 23472
    java.lang.NoSuchMethodError: No virtual method setImageAssetManager(Lcom/airbnb/lottie/manager/ImageAssetManager;)V in class Lcom/airbnb/lottie/LottieDrawable; or its super classes (declaration of 'com.airbnb.lottie.LottieDrawable' appears in /data/app/~~D5JSKL9M3W6HokvkEzNL9A==/com.airbnb.lottie.issues.compose-o-MXvd1YM18tVOgSmcBuTA==/base.apk)
        at com.airbnb.lottie.ImageAssetDelegateSetterKt.setImageAssetManager(ImageAssetDelegateSetter.kt:10)
        at com.airbnb.lottie.compose.LottieAnimationKt$LottieAnimation$3.invoke(LottieAnimation.kt:120)
        at com.airbnb.lottie.compose.LottieAnimationKt$LottieAnimation$3.invoke(LottieAnimation.kt:106)
        at androidx.compose.ui.draw.DrawBackgroundModifier.draw(DrawModifier.kt:101)
```

Both Lottie Compose 1.0.0-beta07-1 and 1.0.0-beta09-1-SNAPSHOT started to crash today. I suspect the culprit is their dependency on Lottie Android 3.7.1-SNAPSHOT which makes non-snapshot Compose builds unstable. However, I couldn't reproduce it locally on master without getting the Lottie dependencies from repositories.

body: Can you try with `rc01-1-SNAPSHOT`? That API is no longer used since https://github.com/airbnb/lottie-android/pull/1836

The deploy is green now. Can you try again?
https://github.com/airbnb/lottie-android/runs/3002160816?check_suite_focus=true
Nice one @gpeal rc01 doesn't crash anymore. However, the stable beta07 linked in the readme crashes. Maybe it should link to the snapshot instead so that people don't use it.

@headsvk Yeah, I'll push a release soon. It's been tricky because I'm in the middle of a major API refactor (mostly complete) but wanted to build out a large set of functionality before releasing but it's in pretty good shape now.
